channel.title: Compile
channel.description:
I have a question, im in the middle of making my own little project to get to know java better, and is it possible to have a compiler that compiles everything in one folder for ex
i run the compile everything in folder "Project" is compiled .
Is this possible?

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’m surprised that nobody noticed that there is no main method in the Gui class.
OP, add the main method and create a new Gui object.

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        new Gui();
    }

etc etc
But you stll wont see anything on screen…

I suggest calling setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE) so your program exits when you press the x button.
At the end of your constructor you need to call the pack() method to re-size your frame to fit all the components. Alternatively you could manually set the size with setSize(int width, int height) method. Finally (and most importantly) you need to call the setVisible(true) method at the end of the constructor to actually display your JFrame.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

This will compile every .java file in the “src” folder, and put all of the .class files in the “bin” folder.

javac -d ./bin/ src/*.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“prison190, post:10, topic:365882”]i know they cant do anything yet, im still testing what i can do. and i use Notepad++ thats it

What do you mean Sticks and tape? What is easier than this?[/quote]

By the way, IDEs have a built in compiler/runner if you haven’t noticed yet. You can chose to preview your application in different versions off windows (Classic, vista etc). I know Netbeans has this, not sure about others.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“prison190, post:7, topic:365882”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=462078.msg3380289#msg3380289 date=1287964987]

Nothing Major just a test pannel for now then i will start to make a game. idk from what tho maybe something creative and fun

LOL.
[/quote]

how is that funny[/quote]

It just is. You have no idea how many times I’ve seen that being said by someone who has no idea about what they are working with or what they are doing. I suggest you start building with sticks and tape, rather than starting with stones and cement.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“prison190, post:5, topic:365882”]Nothing Major just a test pannel for now then i will start to make a game. idk from what tho maybe something creative and fun

and now i get this problem…

this is my gui file.

[code]// My retarded cheap game hopefully this works…
// This will be the game pannel i will be testing this…

/*

  • Class Gui
  • Version 1.0
  • Sunday October 24, 2010
  • Created by Chris
    */

package Chris Game;

import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JLabel;

public class Gui extends JFrame {

private JButton button1;
private JLabel text1;
    private JButton button2;
    private JLabel text2;
private JButton button3;
private JLabel text3;
    private JButton button4;
    private JLabel text4;

public Gui() {
	super("Chris's Game pannel BETA"); // The title bar
	setLayout(new FlowLayout()); // This is the layout of the Gui

	button1 = new JButton("Closed"); //button on the gui
	button1.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	text1 = new JLabel("Under Construction"); //Text on the gui
	text1.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	button2 = new JButton("Closed"); //button on the gui
	button2.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	text2 = new JLabel("Under Construction"); //Text on the gui
	text2.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	button3 = new JButton("Closed"); //button on the gui
	button3.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	text3 = new JLabel("Under Construction"); //Text on the gui
	text3.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	button4 = new JButton("Closed"); //button on the gui
	button4.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	text4 = new JLabel("Under Construction"); //Text on the gui
	text4.setToolTipText("This is what shows up when you hover over it."); //Hover text

	add(button1); //Adds it to the gui
	add(text1);   //Adds it to the gui
            add(button2);
            add(text2);
            add(button3);
            add(text3);
            add(button4);
            add(text4);
	}
}[/code]

[code]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Gui
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Gui
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248)
Could not find the main class: Gui. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

[/code][/quote]

Are you sure you haven’t just used an IDE (Such as netbeans) and used there editor, because it sure looks like it considering you can’t even run it. And the buttons don’t do anything.

Also, let’s all post our source code. [size=1pt]no, not really[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

prison190:

Ok thanks, and will it only compile the java files or will it try to compile everything?

Well if it’s a compiler, then its job is to compile java files. What exactly are you expecting a Java compiler to compile?
